This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ASIAINTHENORTH.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-26T22:20:07Z Erica Baffelli 2015-02-26T22:20:03+00:00 2015-02-26T22:20:03+00:00 Round table: 20 years after the Tokyo subway attack: the impact of Aum's violence in Japan and beyond" Date: March 18th, 5:30-7:00 pm- Manchester https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;19a7bfed.1502 Dear colleagues,<br><br>Just to let you know about this event taking place at the University of Manchester in March.<br>Best wishes,<br>Erica<br><br>[cid:066C984B-3D9B-4506-9592-10092D313D64] Peter Cave 2015-02-06T08:35:09+00:00 2015-02-06T08:35:09+00:00 Japanese Studies Post Graduate Workshop 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;dd9929e4.1502 Dear Colleagues<br><br>Postgrads studying Japan might be interested in the event below. Incidentally, my title is provisional, and could be modified if the interests of the students attending lie in different directions.<br><br>Best regards<br><br>Peter<br><br>Peter Cave<br>Lecturer in Japanese Studies<br>SALC, University of Manchester<br>Samuel Alexander Building<br>Oxford Road<br>Manchester M13 9PL<br>United Kingdom<br>Tel: +44 (0)161 275 3195<br>www.manchester.ac.uk/research/peter.cave/<http://www.manchester.ac.uk/research/peter.cave/><br><br>The Japan Foundation and BAJS<br>(British Association for Japanese Studies) present: [...] Oleg Benesch 2015-01-20T14:36:22+00:00 2015-01-20T14:36:22+00:00 Research Seminar 28 Jan - Dr Mark Pendleton https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;6709d040.1501 Dear All,<br><br>I'm pleased to announce a talk next Wednesday (28 Jan) by Dr Mark Pendleton<br>(University of Sheffield), co-sponsored by the York Asia Research Group and<br>the Department of History. The talk will start at 5:30pm in V/123, with<br>refreshments available in the History reception area from 5:00.<br><br>Please feel free to circulate this note to anyone you think might be<br>interested in attending: [...] Oleg Benesch 2015-01-16T08:18:39+00:00 2015-01-16T08:18:39+00:00 Research seminar on North Korean music https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;d53f27d6.1501 Apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>Catherine Laws <catherine.laws@york.ac.uk>: Jan 15 03:21PM<br><br>You are all invited to the next Music Research Sminar:<br><br>'Sea of Blood': A Night at the North Korean Opera.<br><br>Professor Keith Howard (School of Oriental and African Studies, University<br>of London)<br><br>Wednesday January 21st 4pm<br><br>D003 (Sally Baldwin D Block)<br><br>ALL WELCOME<br><br>In the early 1970s, as the 'new' North Korean ideology of self-reliance<br>bedded in and given that artistic integrity was to remain subservient to<br>ideology, so a new operatic genre emerged. This replaced individual<br>creativity with a collective of composers and artists, and took patriotic<br>stories \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd often [...] Peter Cave 2014-12-19T09:56:48+00:00 2014-12-19T09:56:48+00:00 Postgraduate funding at University of Manchester https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;d936d12c.1412 Dear Colleagues<br><br>Apologies - you are probably getting a bit sick of these, but just to let you know ...<br><br>Funding opportunities in East Asian Studies at Manchester University<br><br>The subject area of East Asian Studies at The University of Manchester is pleased to invite applications for PhD studentships through its membership in AHRC and ESRC consortia. We invite applications from suitably qualified students intending to begin their MA or PhD study in October 2015. [...] Mark Pendleton 2014-12-09T14:49:41+00:00 2014-12-09T14:49:41+00:00 Three jobs going at Sheffield https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;a4190af9.1412 Dear all,<br><br>Please circulate to any interested parties. Sheffield is looking to recruit<br>three positions:<br>- Chair in Chinese Studies,<br>- Senior Lecturer in East Asian Studies (language and discipline spec open)<br>- Lecturer in Chinese Studies.<br><br>Further details at http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/jobs/<br><br>Cheers,<br>Mark<br><br>Dr Mark Pendleton<br>Lecturer in Japanese Studies / Degree Tutor - Japanese Studies / Japan Year<br>Abroad Coordinator<br>Co-editor - History Workshop Online (www.historyworkshop.org.uk) [...] Jon Howlett 2014-12-05T13:06:21+08:00 2014-12-05T13:06:21+08:00 Fwd: UK-China Media and Cultural Studies Conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;37f5ed95.1412 Conference Announcement<br>Call for Papers<br><br>The Inaugural UK-CHINA Media and Cultural Studies Association Conference<br><br>6th January 2015<br><br>Chinese Media and Cultural Studies:<br>Consumption, Content and Crisis.<br><br>Date:<br><br>6th February 2015<br><br>Location:<br><br>School of Journalism, Media and Cultural Studies,<br>Cardiff University<br><br>Bute Building,<br>King Edward VII Ave,<br>Cardiff CF10 3NB<br>UK<br><br>This event is held by the UK-China Media and Cultural Studies<br>Association (UCMECSA), which aims to provide a platform for<br>communication between Chinese media and culture researchers in<br>Britain, and to discuss cultural difference, crossover, communication<br>and diversity among Western countries and China.<br>This conference is intended to facilitate the [...] Peter Cave 2014-12-01T08:16:10+00:00 2014-12-01T08:16:10+00:00 Two seminars: (1) Gender and medical technology (2) Mishima https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;8c157687.1412 Dear Colleagues<br><br>Apologies for the updated email with link to campus map. Just to let you know about two seminars taking place at the University of Manchester in the next week, as follows:<br><br>Wednesday 3 December, 2.00-4.00 pm<br>Ms Kyoko Mimura<br>'Automatic GE Chairs and Images of Japanese Women'<br>University Place 6.210<br>This seminar explores the relationship between gender and medical technology: http://events.manchester.ac.uk/event/event:jmf-i305ww8h-axwp40/japanese-studies-kyoko-mimura-phd-candidate-ochanomizu-university-automatic-ge-chairs-images-of-japanese-womenhttp://events.manchester.ac.uk/event/event:jmf-i305ww8h-axwp40/japanese-studies-kyoko-mimura-phd-candidate-ochanomizu-university-automatic-ge-chairs-images-of-japanese-women [...] Peter Cave 2014-12-01T08:07:19+00:00 2014-12-01T08:07:19+00:00 Two seminars: (1) Gender and medical technology (2) Mishima https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;f025465a.1412 Dear Colleagues<br><br>Just to let you know about two seminars taking place at the University of Manchester in the next week, as follows:<br><br>Wednesday 3 December, 2.00-4.00 pm<br>Ms Kyoko Mimura<br>'Automatic GE Chairs and Images of Japanese Women'<br>University Place 6.210<br>This seminar explores the relationship between gender and medical technology: http://events.manchester.ac.uk/event/event:jmf-i305ww8h-axwp40/japanese-studies-kyoko-mimura-phd-candidate-ochanomizu-university-automatic-ge-chairs-images-of-japanese-womenhttp://events.manchester.ac.uk/event/event:jmf-i305ww8h-axwp40/japanese-studies-kyoko-mimura-phd-candidate-ochanomizu-university-automatic-ge-chairs-images-of-japanese-women<br><br>Monday 8 December, 4.00 - 6.00 pm<br>Dr Damian Flanagan<br>'Who Killed Yukio Mishima? Time and Destiny in the Life and Work of Japan's Master Author and Playwright'<br>University Place 6.208<br>Damian Flanagan, award-winning translator of Soseki and author of several works on the novelist, will talk [...] Sarah Dauncey 2014-11-27T15:17:21+00:00 2014-11-27T15:17:21+00:00 AHRC Midlands3Cities funding for UK/EU students - School of Contemporary Chinese Studies https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;8536e9eb.1411 Please distribute widely. Many thanks. James Rendell 2014-11-21T20:43:55+00:00 2014-11-21T20:43:55+00:00 Exploring 30 Years of Studio Ghibli: Spirited Discussions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;742adacc.1411 Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>A Cardiff University and UEA collaborative project - 18th April 2015 Cardiff University<br><br>2015 marks the 30th anniversary of Studio Ghibli, and with that anniversary it is time to reflect on the domestic and global success of Japan\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds most famous animation studio. With the retirements of Studio Ghibli\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds most famous director, Hayao Miyazaki, and it main producer, Toshio Suzuki earlier this year, the future of Studio Ghibli is in turmoil, provoking rallying cries from fans and critics alike. The Wind Rises may have been Miyazaki\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds swan song, but this is not his first retirement. Despite Miyazaki\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds professed [...] Oleg Benesch 2014-11-20T15:08:06+00:00 2014-11-20T15:08:06+00:00 Event: Hiroshima and the Origins of Global Memory Culture, 1 Dec 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;7590a054.1411 Dear All,<br><br>I would like to call your attention to an event co-hosted by the Asia<br>Research Group and the Department of History. Prof Ran Zwigenberg (Penn<br>State) will be visiting York to give a talk on his new book: *Hiroshima:<br>The Origins of Global Memory Culture* (Cambridge, 2014).<br><br>From the publisher's website:<br>"In 1962, a Hiroshima peace delegation and an Auschwitz survivor's<br>organization exchanged relics and testimonies, including the bones and<br>ashes of Auschwitz victims. This symbolic encounter, in which the dead were<br>literally conscripted in the service of the politics of the living, serves<br>as a cornerstone of [...] Oleg Benesch 2014-11-20T14:55:19+00:00 2014-11-20T14:55:19+00:00 Go Nation: Chinese Masculinities and the Game of Weiqi in China (24 Nov 2014) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;ca836102.1411 Dear All,<br><br>This is a reminder about the upcoming event on Monday, co-hosted by<br>Sociology, the Centre for Women's Studies, and the Asia Research Group.<br>Please feel free to distribute it.<br><br>Best regards,<br>Oleg<br><br>Oleg Benesch, Ph.D.<br>Anniversary Research Lecturer (Assistant Professor)<br>Department of History<br>University of York<br>olegbenesch.com<br><br>Out now:<br>*Inventing the Way of the Samurai*<br>*Nationalism, Internationalism, and Bushid\ufffd\ufffd in Modern Japan *<br>Available through all good bookshops, or direct from Oxford University Press<br><http://ukcatalogue.oup.com/product/9780198706625.do> [...] Peter Cave 2014-11-07T11:45:37+00:00 2014-11-07T11:45:37+00:00 Japanese Language Tutor position at Manchester https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;6a38dae4.1411 Dear Colleagues<br><br>Allow me to draw to your attention this advert for a full-time Japanese Language Tutor at Manchester (application deadline 14 Dec, to start position 26 January 2015). Please circulate and encourage good candidates to apply.<br><br>https://www.jobs.manchester.ac.uk/displayjob.aspx?jobid=8826https://www.jobs.manchester.ac.uk/displayjob.aspx?jobid=8826<br><br>Best regards<br><br>Peter<br><br>Peter Cave<br>Lecturer in Japanese Studies<br>SALC, University of Manchester<br>Samuel Alexander Building<br>Oxford Road<br>Manchester M13 9PL<br>United Kingdom<br>Tel: +44 (0)161 275 3195<br>www.manchester.ac.uk/research/peter.cave/<http://www.manchester.ac.uk/research/peter.cave/> Oleg Benesch 2014-11-02T16:52:37+00:00 2014-11-02T16:52:37+00:00 Event at York: Go Nation: Chinese Masculinities and the Game of Weiqi in China https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;5940bd02.1411 Dear All,<br><br>Please see the attached flyer for information about this event. Please let<br>me know if you have any further questions.<br><br>Best regards,<br>Oleg<br><br>Oleg Benesch, Ph.D.<br>Anniversary Research Lecturer (Assistant Professor)<br>Department of History<br>University of York<br>olegbenesch.com<br><br>Out now:<br>*Inventing the Way of the Samurai*<br>*Nationalism, Internationalism, and Bushid\ufffd\ufffd in Modern Japan *<br>Available through all good bookshops, or direct from Oxford University Press<br><http://ukcatalogue.oup.com/product/9780198706625.do> Oleg Benesch 2014-11-02T16:26:18+00:00 2014-11-02T16:26:18+00:00 Asian History event at York https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;84ccb9dd.1411 Dear All,<br><br>I'm pleased to announce that next week the Department of History at the<br>University of York will be hosting Prof Naoko Shimazu from Birkbeck, U of<br>London in our weekly seminar series:<br><br>*\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDiplomacy as Performative Act: Asian and African Performances at the<br>Bandung Conference of 1955\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd*<br><br>Professor Shimazu's major research is on the cultural history of diplomacy,<br>focusing on the idea of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffddiplomacy as theatre\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. She is interested in<br>examining the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdperformative\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd aspect of international diplomacy, by focusing<br>on the Bandung Conference of 1955 and the rise of the newly independent<br>Asian states as diplomatic actors in the [...] Pierre Fuller 2014-10-23T12:27:45+00:00 2014-10-23T12:27:45+00:00 CALL FOR PAPERS - SOCIAL HISTORY CONFERENCE https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;a2b0163.1410 Dear Asia colleagues,<br><br>Just a quick note to announce the call for papers for the Global and Transnational Strand of the Social History Society's annual conference this academic year from 31 March to 2 April 2015 at Portsmouth. Last year's conference in Newcastle saw the highly successful inaugural appearance of the strand, and we're hoping for an even stronger presence of global/transnational work this time around (broadly defined in the below link). Please circulate this as widely as possible to postgrads, postdocs and colleagues. Thanks so much. [...] Jon Howlett 2014-10-16T07:33:55+08:00 2014-10-16T07:33:55+08:00 New BACS Website and Journal Volume 4 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;7835897f.1410 Dear Asia in the North list members,<br><br>The following may be of interest to those working on greater China who<br>are not currently members of the British Association for Chinese<br>Studies. If you are not already a member, why not sign up today? The<br>Journal is open to all regardless of whether they are a member or not.
